casebody.data:
TEXAS & P. RY. CO. v. CRUMP & BLACK. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. March 17, 1903.) No. 1,217. In Error to the Circuit Court of the IJnited States for the Eastern District of Texas.

Before PARDEE, McCORMIOK, and SHELBY, Circuit Judges.

T. J. Freeman and W. T. Armistead, for plaintiff in error. J. Q. Mahaffey, for defendants in error. PER CURIAM.

As we find none of the assignments of error well taken, nor any reversible error patent on the face of the record, the judgment of the Circuit Court is affirmed.
